item.title: Report E-2025060345
item.description:
Report E-2025060345

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-16
  • City: PITTSFIELD
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The dockworker was unloading a trailer and had his forks too high resulting in a puncture of a 2.5 gallon jerrican. Immediate action was taken to mitigate the spill. 10oz of liquid were spilled. The damaged jerrican was placed in an overpack container. Absorbent pads were put down to absorb any spilled liquid.

item.title: Report E-2025060006
item.description:
Report E-2025060006

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-22
  • City: SO PORTLAND
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: One 05/22/2025, at approximately 13:05 hours, an FRA inspector at the CSX yard in Portland, Maine, discovered tank car GATX 201284, load of Liquefied Petroleum Gas, was leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Blue Racer Midstream, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2025-05-22-0012). Additionally, the South Portland Fire Department and Maine Department of Environmental Protection were notified. Fire department personnel responded and found the cause of the release was the tank car’s Liquid line valve was partially open and the secondary securement plug was less than tool tight. Fire department personnel closed the valve to stop the release. HEPACO, a CSX emergency response contractor, was also dispatched to the incident to conduct a secondary inspection and ensure the car was properly secured for transportation. The issue was identified, and corrective actions, were communicated to the shipper’s representative
